title: Mid-City shooting leaves 4 injured
content:
Four people were injured early Monday morning during a shooting in Mid-City. New Orleans police said the shooting happened around 2:30 a.m. in the 500 block of South Alexander Street.
Two males and two females were shot, police said. The females are 48 and 61 years old, and one of the men is 34 years old. NOPD did not have an age for the fourth victim Monday morning.
The victims were standing outside when two vehicles pulled up and the occupants began shooting, according to a preliminary police report released at 9:30 a.m. Monday. All of the victims were shot multiple times, the report said, with injuries primarily to the legs and hands. NOPD said the injuries were not life-threatening.
The four people were taken to a hospital for treatment.
No information was available Monday morning from NOPD about a possible motive or suspects, but police say the investigation is ongoing. Authorities ask anyone with information on this crime to contact Crimestoppers at 504.822.1111.
NOPD said this shooting was one of two Monday morning that left five people injured. The other shooting happened in eastern New Orleans. NOPD said the two shootings were unrelated.
--
This story was updated at 10:30 a.m. Monday to reflect new information from NOPD.
